radiographic_examinations.findings: Lower chest shows limited evaluation of the lung bases with subpleural blebs and subsegmental atelectasis in both lower lobes. Abdomen reveals colonic diverticulosis with mild pericolonic stranding, a residual 7 mm nonobstructing stone in the lower pole of the left kidney, unchanged hypodense lesions in the right kidney, and no evidence of abscess or fistulous formation.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Few stones previously seen in the lower pole of the left kidney have passed; the right-sided hydronephrosis has resolved.

radiographic_examinations.findings: New faint right basilar opacity may represent atelectasis, but superimposed infection is also considered due to the patient's symptoms.
